title: Neutral effective balance design
description: This EIP proposes a neutral effective balance design to ensure 0x01 (skimming) and 0x02 (compounding) validators receive equal yields by adjusting hysteresis thresholds, resetting EB after withdrawals, and preventing gaming to support stake consolidation.
author: Anders Elowsson (@anderselowsson)
laymanDescription: Makes staking treat 'skimmed' and 'compounding' validators the same by tweaking effective balance rules, so operators can consolidate without losing yield.

endUsers.description: No direct effect; staking reward accounting stays inside the consensus layer and user transactions stay unchanged.

appDevs.description: No app-facing protocol change; validator consolidation does not alter JSON-RPC, gas rules, or transaction semantics.

walletDevs.description: Deposit/withdrawal handling unchanged; no mandatory code updates.

toolingInfra.description: The actual yield becomes in line with existing interpretations of what validators earn.

layer2s.description: No rollup/L2 logic changes identified; this is an L1 consensus-layer adjustment to validator accounting only.

stakersNodes.description: Compounding 0x02 validators get the same yield as 0x01 validators, which they already believed that they did. No longer possible to game partial withdrawals

clClients.description: Must implement neutral EB math, ±0.5/±0.25 hysteresis, and one-time temporary_upward_threshold after withdrawals; moderate integration effort.

elClients.description: No execution-layer work identified; EB and hysteresis are handled in consensus specs, so EL code can remain unchanged.

benefits: Improves capital efficiency for compounding validators.
Supports stake consolidation toward fast finality.
